fresco.abstention package

Submodules

fresco.abstention.abstention module

Module implementing deep-abstaining classifier.

class fresco.abstention.abstention.AbstainingClassifier(kw_args: dict, device: device, class_weights=None, clc: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

Class for deep abstaining classifier.

Parameters:

  • id2label (dict) – Dictionary mapping int values to label values for each task.

  • kw_args (dict) – Dictionary with necessary keywords for abstention.

  • device (str) – ‘cuda’ or ‘cpu’, set from model_suite.py.

abstention_loss(y_pred: tensor, y_true: tensor, idx: int, ntask_abs_prob: int = 1) → tensor[source]

Compute DAC loss.

Parameters:

  • y_pred (torch.tensor) – Logits from model.forward().

  • y_true (torch.tensor) – Integer values of ground truth.

  • idx (int) – Index associated with a task.

  • ntask_abs_prob (float) – Probability of ntask abstaining on the document.

Pre-condition: Loss function defined in class constructor.

add_abstention_classes(dw)[source]

Add abstention class, and ntask if enabled, to data wrangler attributes.

Parameters:

dw (dataHandler) – DataHandler class.

Post-condition:

dw.num_classes updated. dw.dict_maps[‘id2label’] updated with abstention classes. self.abstain_labels populated. self.n_classes populated.

Must be called before creating PathReports class for DataLoaders.

check_abs_stop_metric(stop_metrics)[source]

Check if abstention stopping criteria is satisfied.

Parameters:

stop_metrics – dict Dictionary containing the metrics used for the stopping criteria.

compute_abs_scores(y_true, y_pred, idx)[source]

Compute accuracy scores for a DAC model.

Parameters:

  • y_true – torch.tensor Ground truth values.

  • y_pred – torch.tensor Predicted values.

  • idx – int Index associated with a task.

Note

This method is not presently used as of 11/8.

compute_accuracy(y_true, y_pred)[source]

Compute abstain 0-1 accuracy and abstention rate.

Parameters:

  • y_true (dict) – Dictionary with keys as tasks and values as lists of tensors.

  • y_pred (dict) – Dictionary with keys as tasks and values as lists of tensors.

Post-condition:

The attribute accuracy is cleared and repopulated within this function.

compute_ntask_accuracy(y_true: list, y_pred: list)[source]

Compute ntask abstain 0-1 accuracy and abstention rate.

Parameters:

  • y_true – list List of ground truth values for each task.

  • y_pred – list List of predicted values for each task.

get_ntask_filter(ntask_abs_prob)[source]

Compute the ntask_mask.

Parameters:

ntask_abs_prob – float Probability of abstaining on the entire document.

Note

self.ntask_filter is set to [] at the start of each epoch. This method is called in training.compute_loss and must be called prior to calling compute_accuracy.

modify_alphas(scores, additive=True)[source]

Modify abstention alpha values.

Parameters:

scores – dict A dictionary of dictionaries containing scores. The keys are tasks, and the sub-dictionary contains the following key-value pairs: - ‘micros’: list of micro accuracy scores - ‘abs_rate’: list of abstention rates for each task

Post-condition:

self.alphas are modified in-place.

modify_ntask_alpha(additive)[source]

Modify ntask alpha value.

Parameters:

additive – bool Indicates the type of scaling being used.

Post-condition:

self.ntask_alpha is modified in-place.

Set format output header line.

Pring abstention statis diring training.

Change output header based on tuning mode.

Print output based on tuning mode.

static write_abs_header(tasks)[source]

Write header for abstention stats output file.

write_abs_stats(stop_metrics)[source]

Save abstention stats to output file.

class fresco.abstention.abstention.DacLoss(loss_fun, multilabel, alphas)[source]

Bases: Module

Custom loss class for the DAC.

Parameters:

  • loss_fin (torch.nn.loss) – Torch loss function, either Cross Entropy or Binary Cross Entropy (for multilabel).

  • multilabel (bool) – Indicates if it is a multilabel problem.

  • alphas (torch.Tensor) – Torch tensor of alphas for the DAC.

forward(y_pred: tensor, y_true: tensor, idx: int, ntask_abs_prob: int = 1) → tensor[source]

Compute DAC loss.

Parameters:

  • y_pred (torch.Tensor) – Logits from model.forward().

  • y_true (torch.Tensor) – Integer values of ground truth.

  • idx (int) – Index associated with a task.

  • ntask_abs_prob (float) – Probability of ntask abstaining on the document.

Pre-condition: Loss function defined in class constructor.
